author: Josh Mitchell
title: U.S. Factories Report Strong Demand, as Tariffs, Prices Threaten Expansion
text:
U.S. factories reported robust demand for their products in March but say rising prices for materials, tied to new tariffs, threaten to slow the industryâ€™s expansion.
The Institute for Supply Management said Monday its index of factory activity settled at 59.3 in March, down slightly from 60.8 the prior month. Any reading above 50 indicates rising activity, as measured by factors such as product sales, hiring and production.
